definition: in opposition to; against;
cyclical; repetitive; re-;
to recover ownership of something by paying a sum; redeem
to speak or stand against something in order to stop it from happening; oppose, resist
to take back again; repossess, reacquire
a isolated strip of tender grass; sward, greensward
a charm or incantation; a chant

definition: spear; spear
concatination;
an ideology where the means of production are under common ownership; communism

definition: generous;
a stream, also part of a stream, a shallow; ea, yea, fleet, bourne.
An old name for species of Sideritis: ironwort; later for Galeopsis tetrachi. This herb most likely used as a remedy for gout: Glide element may be OT for limb.; ironwort
origin: [OE: "glide" - move smoothly (element may be OT for limb.)]

definition: a spiritual and holy entity that acts as a messenger between God and earth; angel
nickname of New York; The Big Apple
origin: [Gotham is an Anglo Saxon word meaning “Goat Town” and was first used by Washington Irving in in his satirical 1807 periodical Salmagundi. Irving was comparing the savvy New Yorkers to inhabitants of the tiny English village of Gotham who gained notoriety way back in the thirteenth century by pretending to be insane just to get out of paying taxes to King John]

definition: a brush-footed butterfly found in coastal areas of northeast Scotland such as the Fowlsheugh Nature Reserve and also near the coast around England, such as Fire Beacon Hill; they are often linked with bare ground and rocky hills;
to implement token environmentally friendly iniatives as a way of hiding or deflecting criticism about environmentally destructive practices; none known
origin: [neologism, from OE. words green & wash and based on whitewash]

definition: protection, safe conduct;  in OE law security, peace or protection guaranteed under limitations; quarter (in battle); peace , protection, asylum
origin: [archaic, from OE. gri truce, peace, pardon]
